page.title: 01EAST OF WELLS-NEXT-THE-SEA
page.content: This area lies to the East of Wells-next-the-Sea but includes the edge of the residential area of the town,some limited industrial development on te site of the old railway station and goods yard and the area of the East Quay. The East Quay is the base for the Whelk fishing boats and the 'houses' where the whelks are cooked. Also located here is the Wells Sailing Club which is the main centre in the United Kingdom for the International 12 Square Metre Sharpie sailing dinghy. The rural area can be divided into three parts;the saltmarsh with opportunities for bird watching and wildfowling ,the arable farming land with crops of barley,sugar beet and field vegtables and some grazing land in the valley bottoms.
